reasoning: BRCA1-associated hereditary breast and ovarian cancer accounts for approximately 5-10% of all breast cancers and a higher proportion of ovarian cancers. Estimated incidence ~8.5 per 100k combining both breast and ovarian cancers in BRCA1 carriers. Based on population prevalence of BRCA1 mutations and lifetime risk estimates.
source: Peto J et al. (2000). The contribution of inherited gene mutations to cancer in Europe. Eur J Cancer. 36(18):2352-2382
